io.senseai.kelvinsdk

Class KelvinErrorWakefulBroadcastReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • android.support.v4.content.WakefulBroadcastReceiver
        • io.senseai.kelvinsdk.KelvinErrorWakefulBroadcastReceiver

  • public abstract class KelvinErrorWakefulBroadcastReceiver
extends android.support.v4.content.WakefulBroadcastReceiver
    Abstract class that can be extended to receive error broadcasts from the SDK. Receving any of these broadcasts indicates that the SDK is shutting down. The concrete implementation of this class will need to be registered dynamically. Because this class extends WakefulBroadcastReceiver any intensive operations should be offloaded to a Service / worker thread or an IntentService to prevent blocking the UI thread.

      • getIntentFilter

        public android.content.IntentFilter getIntentFilter()
        When dynamically registering the concrete implementation of this class to recieve local broadcasts from the SDK, this method can be called to obtain the IntentFilter needed during dynamic registration.
        Returns:
        An initialized IntentFilter suitable for receiving the proper local broadcasts from the SDK.

      • onMasterSwitchOff

        protected abstract void onMasterSwitchOff()
        The SDK can be turned off remotely through the use of a master switch. If this callback is called then it means that the master switch has been set to OFF and the SDK will not run again until the master switch is turned back to ON. If you see this error contact support@senseai.io

      • onSdkUpgradeNeeded

        protected abstract void onSdkUpgradeNeeded()
        If an SDK has been deprecated and is no longer supported by the Sense Ai servers then this callback will be called. This error can be remedied by upgrading to a compatible version of the SDK. Contact support@senseai.io for more details.

      • onSdkInternalError

        protected abstract void onSdkInternalError()
        It is possible for the SDK to fall into a situation where it is not possible for it to run. This would occur because of an error on the Sense Ai side. This callback informs the developer that the SDK will no longer run because of an error. Regardless of what's causing the error the SDK needs to make contact with the Sense Ai servers before it will run again however just because it connects to the server doesn't mean that it will be able to run. Contact support@senseai.io if for more details.
